job_roles.description:
The Allegro team is passionate about providing intelligent solutions that move the world toward a safer and more sustainable future. With more than 30 years of experience developing advanced semiconductor technology, innovation with purpose touches every aspect of our business. From customer engagement and employee recognition to technology advancement and serving the local communities in which we maintain offices, innovation consistently drives our mission and definition of success.
Develops and executes security controls, defenses and countermeasures to intercept and prevent internal or external attacks or attempts to infiltrate company email, data, e-commerce and web-based systems. Research attempted or successful efforts to compromise systems security and design countermeasures. Administers security policies to control physical and virtual access to systems. Provides information to management regarding the negative impact on the business caused by theft, destruction, alteration or denial of access to information and systems.

qualifications.requirement: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science
Security+, CISSP, CEH, GCIH, GCIA, GCFA, GPEN, GCCF, CCNA, CCNP or related security certification

Experience and technical knowledge of operating systems, networking, and security practices

job_roles.description:
A Generator Technician will be responsible for the installation, maintenance, and repair of generators and related equipment at the ABICI power plant. The technician will ensure optimal performance and reliability of the power-generating equipment to support the continuous and reliable operation of the ABICI power plant.

- Perform routine inspection, maintenance, and repair on generators and associated systems such as fuel systems, cooling systems, exhaust systems, electrical components and alike
- Diagnose mechanical and electrical faults and implement effective solutions to address issues promptly
- Replace or repair worn or damaged components, such as bearings, belts, and electrical wiring
- Assist in the installation and commissioning of new generators and related equipment
- Ensure all installations meet safety and operational standards and perform necessary testing to confirm proper function
- Respond to emergency breakdowns and perform necessary repairs to minimize downtime
- Maintain accurate records of maintenance activities, repairs, and inspections
- Prepare detailed reports on generator performance and any issues encountered
- Ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations including environmental and safety guideline
- Update maintenance logs and service records as required
- Adhere to all safety protocols and regulations to ensure a safe working environment
- Work closely with Others maintenance staff, engineers, and plant operators to coordinate activities and support overall plant operations
- Provide technical support and training to junior technicians and Others staff members as needed

qualifications.requirement: A graduate of mechanical or electrical engineering with experience in generator engine and electrical system repair
Ability to lift and carry heavy equipment and tools and ability to work in various environmental conditions including confined spaces and elevated heights

Certification in First Aid and CPR

job_roles.description: The Mechatronic Engineer specializing in Drive Systems and Control for Window and Door Systems with a focus on KNX (Konnex) technology is responsible for the design, development, integration, and optimization of automated drive systems within various applications. This role encompasses the use of KNX as standard protocol for building automation and control, allowing for energy-efficient and intelligent control of electromechanical systems. He is responsible for the designing of various door hardware systems, including locks, hinges, door closers, panic devices, and access control systems. The mechanic ensures that all door hardware operates efficiently and safely, providing secure access and enhancing building security The engineer will work closely with cross-disciplinary teams to enhance automation performance, improve system reliability, and facilitate user-friendly operation. Considering all HS&E aspects by developing the façade system to avoid any human damage in following process such as production and installation.

job_roles.description: A Facade Structural Engineer specializes in the design and analysis of building facades, ensuring that they are not only visually appealing but also structurally sound, durable, and able to withstand environmental factors. This role combines engineering principles with architectural design, focusing on the exterior envelope of buildings. He is responsible for the structural design, analysis, and performance of facade systems in buildings. They work closely with architects, facade consultants, and contractors to develop solutions that meet aesthetic and functional criteria while ensuring safety, stability, and compliance with relevant codes and standards Considering all HS&E aspects by developing the façade system to avoid any human damage in following process such as production and installation.
